item.title: Integrating Python with Power BI
item.description: Microsoft have recently enabled Python script as a data source. This is still an experimental phase, yet a nice feature for those who uses Python on a day to day basis. Microsoft Power BI Desktop version nicely integrates with Python. Python is an open source general purpose language and has become one of top prigramming language for data science. Power BI is Microsoftâ€™s flagship BI tool for creating dashboards and interactive reports.

item.title: Python using RStudio IDE
item.description: Today is 7/26 This is test post to check if Python code works library(reticulate) ## Warning: package 'reticulate' was built under R version 3.4.4 import numpy as np x = [1, 2, 3] print(x) ## [1, 2, 3] y = np.mean(x) \(\bar{x}\) is the average, which is defined as \[ \bar{x} = \frac{\sum x}{n} \] So what is the aveage of y? It is 2. x = c(1:5) The value of x is R session is 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.
